trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to try and fix any problems with your hard drive.

seg-source.mrk: Follow these steps to try and fix any problems with your hard drive.

target.mrk: Follow these steps to try and fix any problems with your hard drive.

trans-unit.source: Run scandisk on the drive. This may solve all of your problems.

seg-source.mrk: This may solve all of your problems.

target.mrk: This may solve all of your problems.

trans-unit.source: Try defragmenting the drive. This could help with retrieval times.

seg-source.mrk: This could help with retrieval times.

target.mrk: This could help with retrieval times.

trans-unit.source: If the drive is still slow, try deleting old or useless information.

seg-source.mrk: If the drive is still slow, try deleting old or useless information.

target.mrk: If the drive is still slow, try deleting old or useless information.

trans-unit.source: If the drive cannot access anything, there are some expensive tools at Best Buy that my help you save some of your information. But, you're probably out of luck.

seg-source.mrk: If the drive cannot access anything, there are some expensive tools at Best Buy that my help you save some of your information.
But, you're probably out of luck.

target.mrk: If the drive cannot access anything, there are some expensive tools at Best Buy that my help you save some of your information.
But, you're probably out of luck.

trans-unit.source: If the drive makes funny clicking noises, back everything up as soon as possible.

seg-source.mrk: If the drive makes funny clicking noises, back everything up as soon as possible.

target.mrk: If the drive makes funny clicking noises, back everything up as soon as possible.

trans-unit.source: You probably have some important data stored in bad sectors. This is going to be painful to fix. Make sure you have a copy of your Operating System CDs.

seg-source.mrk: You probably have some important data stored in bad sectors.
This is going to be painful to fix.
Make sure you have a copy of your Operating System CDs.

target.mrk: You probably have some important data stored in bad sectors.
This is going to be painful to fix.
Make sure you have a copy of your Operating System CDs.

trans-unit.source: If all else fails, you can always try calling technical support. However, this can be very expensive, unless you call within 13 hours of your purchase.

seg-source.mrk: If all else fails, you can always try calling technical support.
However, this can be very expensive, unless you call within 13 hours of your purchase.

target.mrk: If all else fails, you can always try calling technical support.
However, this can be very expensive, unless you call within 13 hours of your purchase.
